meanings.definition: A tall pole decorated with flowers and ribbons, around which people dance during May Day celebrations.
meanings.sent1: During the May Day festival, children danced joyfully around the maypole.
meanings.sent2: The community gathered around the maypole to celebrate the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel climbed up the maypole and started swinging from the ribbons.
meanings.sent4: The maypole stood tall like a colorful beacon in the center of the village square.
meanings.sent5: The maypole, adorned with bright flowers, swayed gently in the breeze.

meanings.definition: A pole or post set up as a symbol of May Day festivities.
meanings.sent1: The small town proudly displayed a maypole in the town square for May Day.
meanings.sent2: The tradition of erecting a maypole dates back centuries in this village.
meanings.sent3: The maypole cast a long shadow in the setting sun, creating a picturesque scene.
meanings.sent4: The maypole stood tall and proud, symbolizing the unity of the community.
meanings.sent5: As the sun rose, the maypole's silhouette against the sky marked the beginning of May Day.
